---
title: Christian Robert's talk on simulation
author: Sam Clifford
date: 2012-08-21
tags: ["blog","Blog","brag","christian robert","qut","science","seminar","simulation","statistics","storify","twitter"]
---

This morning I went to see [Christian Robert](http://www.amsi.org.au/research-a-higher-education/rhenews/828-prof-christian-robert-lecture-tour) talk at QUT about the use of [simulation as a tool in statistics](http://xianblog.wordpress.com/2012/07/10/simulation-an-ubiquitous-tool/) (contains the slides from the talk). Overall it was quite an interesting talk although it was aimed at a less statistical audience than it was received by (mostly PhD students from Kerrie Mengersen's BRAG group). I livetweeted the talk using the hashtags [#xian](https://twitter.com/#!/search/%23xian) and [#amsi](https://twitter.com/#!/search/%23amsi) and have tried scraping my tweets using the tool described [here](http://mashe.hawksey.info/2011/11/twitter-how-to-archive-event-hashtags-and-visualize-conversation/). So I've now got a handy little archive of the tweets that I made. Turns out #xian is a poor choice of hashtag as it's a region in China. Edit: I've replaced the scraped tweets with a Storify thingo instead.
